## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_evaluation_dataset](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_evaluation_dataset) Create Evaluation Dataset\
\
To create an evaluation dataset, send a POST request to `/v2/gen-ai/evaluation_datasets`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| file\_upload\_dataset | object (apiFileUploadDataSource) <br>File to upload as data source for knowledge base. |\
| name | string<br>The name of the agent evaluation dataset. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
post/v2/gen-ai/evaluation\_datasets\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/evaluation\_datasets\
\
### Request samples\
\
- Payload\
- cURL\
\
Content type\
\
application/json\
\
Copy\
Expand all  Collapse all\
\
`{"file_upload_dataset": {"original_file_name": "example name",\
\
"size_in_bytes": "12345",\
\
"stored_object_key": "example string"\
\
},\
\
"name": "example name"\
\
}`\
\
### Response samples\
\
- 200\
- 401\
- 404\
- 429\
- 500\
- default\
\
Content type\
\
application/json\
\
Copy\
\
`{"evaluation_dataset_uuid": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"\
\
}`\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_evaluation_dataset_file_upload_presigned_urls](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_evaluation_dataset_file_upload_presigned_urls) Create Presigned URLs for Evaluation Dataset File Upload\
\
To create presigned URLs for evaluation dataset file upload, send a POST request to `/v2/gen-ai/evaluation_datasets/file_upload_presigned_urls`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| files | Array of objects (apiPresignedUrlFile) <br>A list of files to generate presigned URLs for. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
post/v2/gen-ai/evaluation\_datasets/file\_upload\_presigned\_urls\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/evaluation\_datasets/file\_upload\_presigned\_urls\
\
### Request samples\
\
- Payload\
- cURL\
\
Content type\
\
application/json\
\
Copy\
Expand all  Collapse all\
\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_knowledge_base](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_knowledge_base) Create a Knowledge Base\
\
To create a knowledge base, send a POST request to `/v2/gen-ai/knowledge_bases`.\

##### Authorizations:\

\
|     |     |\

| name | string<br>Name of the knowledge base. |\
| project\_id | string<br>Identifier of the DigitalOcean project this knowledge base will belong to. |\
| region | string<br>The datacenter region to deploy the knowledge base in. |\
| tags | Array of strings<br>Tags to organize your knowledge base. |\
| vpc\_uuid | string<br>The VPC to deploy the knowledge base database in |\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_list_models](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_list_models) List Available Models\
\
To list all models, send a GET request to `/v2/gen-ai/models`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| usecases | Array of strings<br>Items Enum:"MODEL\_USECASE\_UNKNOWN""MODEL\_USECASE\_AGENT""MODEL\_USECASE\_FINETUNED""MODEL\_USECASE\_KNOWLEDGEBASE""MODEL\_USECASE\_GUARDRAIL""MODEL\_USECASE\_REASONING""MODEL\_USECASE\_SERVERLESS"<br>Example: usecases=MODEL\_USECASE\_UNKNOWN<br>Include only models defined for the listed usecases.<br>- MODEL\_USECASE\_UNKNOWN: The use case of the model is unknown<br>- MODEL\_USECASE\_AGENT: The model maybe used in an agent<br>- MODEL\_USECASE\_FINETUNED: The model maybe used for fine tuning<br>- MODEL\_USECASE\_KNOWLEDGEBASE: The model maybe used for knowledge bases (embedding models)<br>- MODEL\_USECASE\_GUARDRAIL: The model maybe used for guardrails<br>- MODEL\_USECASE\_REASONING: The model usecase for reasoning<br>- MODEL\_USECASE\_SERVERLESS: The model usecase for serverless inference |\
| public\_only | boolean<br>Example: public\_only=true<br>Only include models that are publicly available. |\
| page | integer<br>Example: page=1<br>Page number. |\
| per\_page | integer<br>Example: per\_page=1<br>Items per page. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_update_openai_api_key](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_update_openai_api_key) Update OpenAI API Key\
\
To update an OpenAI API key, send a PUT request to `/v2/gen-ai/openai/keys/{api_key_uuid}`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| api\_key\_uuid<br>required | string<br>Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"<br>API key ID |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| api\_key | string<br>OpenAI API key |\
| api\_key\_uuid | string<br>API key ID |\
| name | string<br>Name of the key |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
put/v2/gen-ai/openai/keys/{api\_key\_uuid}\

production\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_list_datacenter_regions](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_list_datacenter_regions) List Datacenter Regions\
\
To list all datacenter regions, send a GET request to `/v2/gen-ai/regions`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| serves\_inference | boolean<br>Example: serves\_inference=true<br>Include datacenters that serve inference. |\
| serves\_batch | boolean<br>Example: serves\_batch=true<br>Include datacenters that are capable of running batch jobs. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
get/v2/gen-ai/regions\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/regions\
\
### Request samples\
\
- cURL\
\
Copy\
\
```\
curl -X GET \\
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"  \\
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $DIGITALOCEAN_TOKEN" \\
  "https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/regions"\
```\
\
### Response samples\
\
- 200\
- 401\
- 404\
- 429\
- 500\
- default\
\
Content type\
\
application/json\
\
Copy\
Expand all  Collapse all\
\
`{"regions": [{"inference_url": "example string",\
\
"region": "example string",\
\
"serves_batch": true,\
\
"serves_inference": true,\
\
"stream_inference_url": "example string"\
\
}\
\
]\
\
}`\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_scheduled_indexing](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_scheduled_indexing) Create scheduled indexing for knowledge base\
\
To create scheduled indexing for a knowledge base, send a POST request to `/v2/gen-ai/scheduled-indexing`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| days | Array of integers <int32> \[ items <int32 > \]<br>Days for execution (day is represented same as in a cron expression, e.g. Monday begins with 1 ) |\
| knowledge\_base\_uuid | string<br>Knowledge base uuid for which the schedule is created |\
| time | string<br>Time of execution (HH:MM) UTC |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
post/v2/gen-ai/scheduled-indexing\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/scheduled-indexing\
\
### Request samples\
\
- Payload\
- cURL\
\
Content type\
\
application/json\
\

\
],\
\
"knowledge_base_uuid": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",\
\
"time": "example string"\
\
}`\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_workspace](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_create_workspace) Create a Workspace\
\
To create a new workspace, send a POST request to `/v2/gen-ai/workspaces`. The response body contains a JSON object with the newly created workspace object.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| agent\_uuids | Array of strings<br>Ids of the agents(s) to attach to the workspace |\
| description | string<br>Description of the workspace |\
| name | string<br>Name of the workspace |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
post/v2/gen-ai/workspaces\
\

\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_get_workspace](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_get_workspace) Retrieve an Existing Workspace\
\
To retrieve details of a workspace, GET request to `/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace_uuid}`. The response body is a JSON object containing the workspace.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| workspace\_uuid<br>required | string<br>Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"<br>Workspace UUID. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
get/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}\
\
### Request samples\
\
- cURL\
\
Copy\
\
```\
curl -X GET \\
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"  \\
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $DIGITALOCEAN_TOKEN" \\
  "https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/c441bf77-81d6-11ef-bf8f-4e013e2ddde4"\
```\
\
### Response samples\
\
- 200\
- 401\
- 404\
- 429\
- 500\
- default\

application/json\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_update_workspace](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_update_workspace) Update a Workspace\
\
To update a workspace, send a PUT request to `/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace_uuid}`. The response body is a JSON object containing the workspace.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| workspace\_uuid<br>required | string<br>Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"<br>Workspace UUID. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| description | string<br>The new description of the workspace |\
| name | string<br>The new name of the workspace |\
| workspace\_uuid | string<br>Workspace UUID. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
put/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}\
\
### Request samples\
\
- Payload\
- cURL\
\
Content type\
\
application/json\
\
Copy\
\
`{"description": "example string",\
\
"name": "example name",\
\
"workspace_uuid": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"\
\
}`\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_delete_workspace](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_delete_workspace) Delete a Workspace\
\
To delete a workspace, send a DELETE request to `/v2/gen-ai/workspace/{workspace_uuid}`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| workspace\_uuid<br>required | string<br>Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"<br>Workspace UUID. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
delete/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}\
\
### Request samples\
\
- cURL\
\
Copy\
\
```\
curl -X DELETE \\
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"  \\
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $DIGITALOCEAN_TOKEN" \\
  "https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/5581a586-a745-11ef-bf8f-4e013e2ddde4"\
```\
\
### Response samples\
\
- 200\
- 401\
- 404\
- 429\
- 500\
- default\
\
Content type\
\
application/json\
\
Copy\
\
`{"workspace_uuid": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"\
\
}`\
\
## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_list_agents_by_workspace](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_list_agents_by_workspace) List agents by Workspace\
\
To list all agents by a Workspace, send a GET request to `/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace_uuid}/agents`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| workspace\_uuid<br>required | string<br>Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"<br>Workspace UUID. |\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| only\_deployed | boolean<br>Example: only\_deployed=true<br>Only list agents that are deployed. |\
| page | integer<br>Example: page=1<br>Page number. |\
| per\_page | integer<br>Example: per\_page=1<br>Items per page. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
get/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}/agents\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}/agents\
\
### Request samples\
\
- cURL\
\
Copy\
\
```\
curl -X GET \\
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"  \\
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $DIGITALOCEAN_TOKEN" \\
  "https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/11efb7d6-cdb5-6388-bf8f-4e013e2ddde4/agents"\
```\
\
### Response samples\
\
- 200\
- 401\
- 404\

- default\

## [tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_update_agents_workspace](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/GradientAI-Platform/operation/genai_update_agents_workspace) Move Agents to a Workspace\
\
To move all listed agents a given workspace, send a PUT request to `/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace_uuid}/agents`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| workspace\_uuid<br>required | string<br>Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"<br>Workspace uuid to move agents to |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| agent\_uuids | Array of strings<br>Agent uuids |\
| workspace\_uuid | string<br>Workspace uuid to move agents to |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A successful response.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
put/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}/agents\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/gen-ai/workspaces/{workspace\_uuid}/agents\

## [tag/Image-Actions](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Image-Actions) Image Actions\
\
Image actions are commands that can be given to a DigitalOcean image. In\
general, these requests are made on the actions endpoint of a specific\
image.\
\
An image action object is returned. These objects hold the current status\
of the requested action.\
\
## [tag/Image-Actions/operation/imageActions_list](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Image-Actions/operation/imageActions_list) List All Actions for an Image\
\
To retrieve all actions that have been executed on an image, send a GET request to `/v2/images/$IMAGE_ID/actions`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| image\_id<br>required | integer<br>Example: 62137902<br>A unique number that can be used to identify and reference a specific image. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
The results will be returned as a JSON object with an `actions` key. This will be set to an array filled with action objects containing the standard action attributes.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
get/v2/images/{image\_id}/actions\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/images/{image\_id}/actions\
\

\
- cURL\
- Go\
- Python\

\

curl -X GET \\
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $DIGITALOCEAN_TOKEN" \\
  "https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/images/7555620/actions?page=1&per_page=1"\

## [tag/Image-Actions/operation/imageActions_post](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Image-Actions/operation/imageActions_post) Initiate an Image Action\
\
The following actions are available on an Image.\
\
## Convert an Image to a Snapshot\
\
To convert an image, for example, a backup to a snapshot, send a POST request\
to `/v2/images/$IMAGE_ID/actions`. Set the `type` attribute to `convert`.\
\
## Transfer an Image\
\
To transfer an image to another region, send a POST request to\
`/v2/images/$IMAGE_ID/actions`. Set the `type` attribute to `transfer` and set\
`region` attribute to the slug identifier of the region you wish to transfer\
to.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| image\_id<br>required | integer<br>Example: 62137902<br>A unique number that can be used to identify and reference a specific image. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| type<br>required | string<br>The action to be taken on the image. Can be either `convert` or `transfer`.<br>converttransferconvert |\
\
### Responses\
\
**201**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `action`. The value of this will be an object containing the standard image action attributes.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
post/v2/images/{image\_id}/actions\
\
production\

https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/images/{image\_id}/actions\

## [tag/Images](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Images) Images\
\
A DigitalOcean [image](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/images/) can be\
used to create a Droplet and may come in a number of flavors. Currently,\
there are five types of images: snapshots, backups, applications,\
distributions, and custom images.\
\
- [Snapshots](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/snapshots/) provide\
a full copy of an existing Droplet instance taken on demand.\
\
- [Backups](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/backups/) are similar\
to snapshots but are created automatically at regular intervals when\
enabled for a Droplet.\
\
- [Custom images](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/custom-images/)\
are Linux-based virtual machine images (raw, qcow2, vhdx, vdi, and vmdk\
formats are supported) that you may upload for use on DigitalOcean.\
\
- Distributions are the public Linux distributions that are available to\
be used as a base to create Droplets.\
\
- Applications, or [1-Click Apps](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/marketplace/),\
are distributions pre-configured with additional software.\
\
\
To interact with images, you will generally send requests to the images\
endpoint at /v2/images.\
\
## [tag/Images/operation/images_list](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Images/operation/images_list) List All Images\
\
To list all of the images available on your account, send a GET request to /v2/images.\
\
## Filtering Results\
\
* * *\
\
It's possible to request filtered results by including certain query parameters.\
\
**Image Type**\
\
Either 1-Click Application or OS Distribution images can be filtered by using the `type` query parameter.\
\
> Important: The `type` query parameter does not directly relate to the `type` attribute.\
\
To retrieve only _**distribution**_ images, include the `type` query parameter set to distribution, `/v2/images?type=distribution`.\
\
To retrieve only _**application**_ images, include the `type` query parameter set to application, `/v2/images?type=application`.\
\
**User Images**\
\
To retrieve only the private images of a user, include the `private` query parameter set to true, `/v2/images?private=true`.\
\
**Tags**\
\
To list all images assigned to a specific tag, include the `tag_name` query parameter set to the name of the tag in your GET request. For example, `/v2/images?tag_name=$TAG_NAME`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| type | string<br>Enum:"application""distribution"<br>Example: type=distribution<br>Filters results based on image type which can be either `application` or `distribution`. |\
| private | boolean<br>Example: private=true<br>Used to filter only user images. |\
| tag\_name | string<br>Example: tag\_name=base-image<br>Used to filter images by a specific tag. |\
| per\_page | integer \[ 1 .. 200 \] <br>Default: 20<br>Example: per\_page=2<br>Number of items returned per page |\
| page | integer >= 1 <br>Default: 1<br>Example: page=1<br>Which 'page' of paginated results to return. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `images`. This will be set to an array of image objects, each of which will contain the standard image attributes.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
get/v2/images\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/images\
\

## [tag/Images/operation/images_create_custom](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Images/operation/images_create_custom) Create a Custom Image\
\
To create a new custom image, send a POST request to /v2/images.\
The body must contain a url attribute pointing to a Linux virtual machine\
image to be imported into DigitalOcean.\
The image must be in the raw, qcow2, vhdx, vdi, or vmdk format.\
It may be compressed using gzip or bzip2 and must be smaller than 100 GB after\
being decompressed.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| name<br>required | string (image\_name) <br>The display name that has been given to an image. This is what is shown in the control panel and is generally a descriptive title for the image in question. |\
| distribution | string (distribution) <br>Enum:"Arch Linux""CentOS""CoreOS""Debian""Fedora""Fedora Atomic""FreeBSD""Gentoo""openSUSE""RancherOS""Rocky Linux""Ubuntu""Unknown"<br>The name of a custom image's distribution. Currently, the valid values are `Arch Linux`, `CentOS`, `CoreOS`, `Debian`, `Fedora`, `Fedora Atomic`, `FreeBSD`, `Gentoo`, `openSUSE`, `RancherOS`, `Rocky Linux`, `Ubuntu`, and `Unknown`. Any other value will be accepted but ignored, and `Unknown` will be used in its place. |\
| description | string (image\_description) <br>An optional free-form text field to describe an image. |\
| url<br>required | string<br>A URL from which the custom Linux virtual machine image may be retrieved. The image it points to must be in the raw, qcow2, vhdx, vdi, or vmdk format. It may be compressed using gzip or bzip2 and must be smaller than 100 GB after being decompressed. |\
| region<br>required | string (region\_slug) <br>Enum:"ams1""ams2""ams3""blr1""fra1""lon1""nyc1""nyc2""nyc3""sfo1""sfo2""sfo3""sgp1""tor1""syd1"<br>The slug identifier for the region where the resource will initially be available. |\
| tags | Array of strings or null (tags\_array) <br>A flat array of tag names as strings to be applied to the resource. Tag names may be for either existing or new tags. <br>Requires `tag:create` scope. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**202**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key set to `image`. The value of this will be an image object containing a subset of the standard image attributes as listed below, including the image's `id` and `status`. After initial creation, the `status` will be `NEW`. Using the image's id, you may query the image's status by sending a `GET` request to the `/v2/images/$IMAGE_ID` endpoint. When the `status` changes to `available`, the image will be ready for use.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
post/v2/images\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/images\
\

## [tag/Kubernetes](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes) Kubernetes\
\
[DigitalOcean Kubernetes](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/kubernetes/)\
allows you to quickly deploy scalable and secure Kubernetes clusters. By\
sending requests to the `/v2/kubernetes/clusters` endpoint, you can list,\
create, or delete clusters as well as scale node pools up and down,\
recycle individual nodes, and retrieve the kubeconfig file for use with\
a cluster.\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_create_cluster](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_create_cluster) Create a New Kubernetes Cluster\
\
To create a new Kubernetes cluster, send a POST request to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters`. The request must contain at least one node pool\
with at least one worker.\
\
The request may contain a maintenance window policy describing a time period\
when disruptive maintenance tasks may be carried out. Omitting the policy\
implies that a window will be chosen automatically. See\
[here](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/kubernetes/how-to/upgrade-cluster/)\
for details.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| name<br>required | string<br>A human-readable name for a Kubernetes cluster. |\
| region<br>required | string<br>The slug identifier for the region where the Kubernetes cluster is located. |\
| version<br>required | string<br>The slug identifier for the version of Kubernetes used for the cluster. If set to a minor version (e.g. "1.14"), the latest version within it will be used (e.g. "1.14.6-do.1"); if set to "latest", the latest published version will be used. See the `/v2/kubernetes/options` endpoint to find all currently available versions. |\
| cluster\_subnet | string <cidr> <br>The range of IP addresses for the overlay network of the Kubernetes cluster in CIDR notation. |\
| service\_subnet | string <cidr> <br>The range of assignable IP addresses for services running in the Kubernetes cluster in CIDR notation. |\
| vpc\_uuid | string <uuid> <br>A string specifying the UUID of the VPC to which the Kubernetes cluster is assigned.<br>Requires `vpc:read` scope. |\
| tags | Array of strings<br>An array of tags to apply to the Kubernetes cluster. All clusters are automatically tagged `k8s` and `k8s:$K8S_CLUSTER_ID`. <br>Requires `tag:read` and `tag:create` scope, as well as `tag:delete` if existing tags are getting removed. |\
| node\_pools<br>required | Array of objects (kubernetes\_node\_pool) <br>An object specifying the details of the worker nodes available to the Kubernetes cluster. |\
| maintenance\_policy | object or null (maintenance\_policy) <br>An object specifying the maintenance window policy for the Kubernetes cluster. |\
| auto\_upgrade | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether the cluster will be automatically upgraded to new patch releases during its maintenance window. |\
| surge\_upgrade | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether surge upgrade is enabled/disabled for the cluster. Surge upgrade makes cluster upgrades fast and reliable by bringing up new nodes before destroying the outdated nodes. |\
| ha | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether the control plane is run in a highly available configuration in the cluster. Highly available control planes incur less downtime. The property cannot be disabled. |\
| control\_plane\_firewall | object or null (control\_plane\_firewall) <br>An object specifying the control plane firewall for the Kubernetes cluster. Control plane firewall is in early availability (invite only). |\
| cluster\_autoscaler\_configuration | object or null (cluster\_autoscaler\_configuration) <br>An object specifying custom cluster autoscaler configuration. |\
| routing\_agent | object or null (routing\_agent) <br>An object specifying whether the routing-agent component should be enabled for the Kubernetes cluster. |\
| amd\_gpu\_device\_plugin | object or null (amd\_gpu\_device\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the AMD GPU Device Plugin should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. It's enabled by default for clusters with an AMD GPU node pool. |\
| amd\_gpu\_device\_metrics\_exporter\_plugin | object or null (amd\_gpu\_device\_metrics\_exporter\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the AMD Device Metrics Exporter should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. |\
| nvidia\_gpu\_device\_plugin | object or null (nvidia\_gpu\_device\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the Nvidia GPU Device Plugin should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. It's enabled by default for clusters with an Nvidia GPU node pool. |\
| rdma\_shared\_dev\_plugin | object or null (rdma\_shared\_dev\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the RDMA shared device plugin should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**201**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `kubernetes_cluster`. The\
value of this will be an object containing the standard attributes of a\
Kubernetes cluster.\
\
The IP address and cluster API server endpoint will not be available until the\
cluster has finished provisioning. The initial value of the cluster's\
`status.state` attribute will be `provisioning`. When the cluster is ready,\
this will transition to `running`.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
post/v2/kubernetes/clusters\
\
production\
\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_update_cluster](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_update_cluster) Update a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
To update a Kubernetes cluster, send a PUT request to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID` and specify one or more of the\
attributes below.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| name<br>required | string<br>A human-readable name for a Kubernetes cluster. |\
| tags | Array of strings<br>An array of tags applied to the Kubernetes cluster. All clusters are automatically tagged `k8s` and `k8s:$K8S_CLUSTER_ID`. |\
| maintenance\_policy | object or null (maintenance\_policy) <br>An object specifying the maintenance window policy for the Kubernetes cluster. |\
| auto\_upgrade | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether the cluster will be automatically upgraded to new patch releases during its maintenance window. |\
| surge\_upgrade | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether surge upgrade is enabled/disabled for the cluster. Surge upgrade makes cluster upgrades fast and reliable by bringing up new nodes before destroying the outdated nodes. |\
| ha | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether the control plane is run in a highly available configuration in the cluster. Highly available control planes incur less downtime. The property cannot be disabled. |\
| control\_plane\_firewall | object or null (control\_plane\_firewall) <br>An object specifying the control plane firewall for the Kubernetes cluster. Control plane firewall is in early availability (invite only). |\
| cluster\_autoscaler\_configuration | object or null (cluster\_autoscaler\_configuration) <br>An object specifying custom cluster autoscaler configuration. |\
| routing\_agent | object or null (routing\_agent) <br>An object specifying whether the routing-agent component should be enabled for the Kubernetes cluster. |\
| amd\_gpu\_device\_plugin | object or null (amd\_gpu\_device\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the AMD GPU Device Plugin should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. It's enabled by default for clusters with an AMD GPU node pool. |\
| amd\_gpu\_device\_metrics\_exporter\_plugin | object or null (amd\_gpu\_device\_metrics\_exporter\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the AMD Device Metrics Exporter should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. |\
| nvidia\_gpu\_device\_plugin | object or null (nvidia\_gpu\_device\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the Nvidia GPU Device Plugin should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. It's enabled by default for clusters with an Nvidia GPU node pool. |\
| rdma\_shared\_dev\_plugin | object or null (rdma\_shared\_dev\_plugin) <br>An object specifying whether the RDMA shared device plugin should be enabled in the Kubernetes cluster. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**202**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `kubernetes_cluster`. The\
value of this will be an object containing the standard attributes of a\
Kubernetes cluster.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\

\

request to `/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID`.\
\
A 204 status code with no body will be returned in response to a successful\
request.\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_destroy_associatedResourcesSelective](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_destroy_associatedResourcesSelective) Selectively Delete a Cluster and its Associated Resources\
\
To delete a Kubernetes cluster along with a subset of its associated resources,\
send a DELETE request to `/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/destroy_with_associated_resources/selective`.\
\
The JSON body of the request should include `load_balancers`, `volumes`, or\
`volume_snapshots` keys each set to an array of IDs for the associated\
resources to be destroyed.\
\
The IDs can be found by querying the cluster's associated resources endpoint.\
Any associated resource not included in the request will remain and continue\
to accrue changes on your account.\

\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| load\_balancers | Array of strings<br>A list of IDs for associated load balancers to destroy along with the cluster. |\
| volumes | Array of strings<br>A list of IDs for associated volumes to destroy along with the cluster. |\
| volume\_snapshots | Array of strings<br>A list of IDs for associated volume snapshots to destroy along with the cluster. |\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_get_kubeconfig](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_get_kubeconfig) Retrieve the kubeconfig for a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
This endpoint returns a kubeconfig file in YAML format. It can be used to\
connect to and administer the cluster using the Kubernetes command line tool,\
`kubectl`, or other programs supporting kubeconfig files (e.g., client libraries).\
\
The resulting kubeconfig file uses token-based authentication for clusters\
supporting it, and certificate-based authentication otherwise. For a list of\
supported versions and more information, see " [How to Connect to a DigitalOcean\\
Kubernetes Cluster](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/kubernetes/how-to/connect-to-cluster/)".\
\
To retrieve a kubeconfig file for use with a Kubernetes cluster, send a GET\
request to `/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/kubeconfig`.\
\
Clusters supporting token-based authentication may define an expiration by\
passing a duration in seconds as a query parameter to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/kubeconfig?expiry_seconds=$DURATION_IN_SECONDS`.\
If not set or 0, then the token will have a 7 day expiry. The query parameter\
has no impact in certificate-based authentication.\
\
Kubernetes Roles granted to a user with a token-based kubeconfig are derived from that user's\
DigitalOcean role. Predefined roles (Owner, Member, Modifier etc.) have an automatic mapping\
to Kubernetes roles. Custom roles are not automatically mapped to any Kubernetes roles,\
and require [additional configuration](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/kubernetes/how-to/set-up-custom-rolebindings/)\
by a cluster administrator.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| expiry\_seconds | integer >= 0 <br>Default: 0<br>Example: expiry\_seconds=300<br>The duration in seconds that the returned Kubernetes credentials will be valid. If not set or 0, the credentials will have a 7 day expiry. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A kubeconfig file for the cluster in YAML format.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_get_credentials](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_get_credentials) Retrieve Credentials for a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
This endpoint returns a JSON object . It can be used to programmatically\
construct Kubernetes clients which cannot parse kubeconfig files.\
\
The resulting JSON object contains token-based authentication for clusters\
supporting it, and certificate-based authentication otherwise. For a list of\
supported versions and more information, see " [How to Connect to a DigitalOcean\\
Kubernetes Cluster](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/kubernetes/how-to/connect-to-cluster/)".\
\
To retrieve credentials for accessing a Kubernetes cluster, send a GET\
request to `/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/credentials`.\
\
Clusters supporting token-based authentication may define an expiration by\
passing a duration in seconds as a query parameter to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/credentials?expiry_seconds=$DURATION_IN_SECONDS`.\
If not set or 0, then the token will have a 7 day expiry. The query parameter\
has no impact in certificate-based authentication.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| expiry\_seconds | integer >= 0 <br>Default: 0<br>Example: expiry\_seconds=300<br>The duration in seconds that the returned Kubernetes credentials will be valid. If not set or 0, the credentials will have a 7 day expiry. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A JSON object containing credentials for a cluster.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
get/v2/kubernetes/clusters/{cluster\_id}/credentials\
\
production\
\
https://api.digitalocean.com/v2/kubernetes/clusters/{cluster\_id}/credentials\

\
To determine whether a cluster can be upgraded, and the versions to which it\
can be upgraded, send a GET request to\

\
To immediately upgrade a Kubernetes cluster to a newer patch release of\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_add_nodePool](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_add_nodePool) Add a Node Pool to a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
To add an additional node pool to a Kubernetes clusters, send a POST request\
to `/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/node_pools` with the following\
attributes.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| size<br>required | string<br>The slug identifier for the type of Droplet used as workers in the node pool. |\
| name<br>required | string<br>A human-readable name for the node pool. |\
| count<br>required | integer<br>The number of Droplet instances in the node pool. |\
| tags | Array of strings<br>An array containing the tags applied to the node pool. All node pools are automatically tagged `k8s`, `k8s-worker`, and `k8s:$K8S_CLUSTER_ID`. <br>Requires `tag:read` scope. |\
| labels | object or null<br>An object of key/value mappings specifying labels to apply to all nodes in a pool. Labels will automatically be applied to all existing nodes and any subsequent nodes added to the pool. Note that when a label is removed, it is not deleted from the nodes in the pool. |\
| taints | Array of objects (kubernetes\_node\_pool\_taint) <br>An array of taints to apply to all nodes in a pool. Taints will automatically be applied to all existing nodes and any subsequent nodes added to the pool. When a taint is removed, it is deleted from all nodes in the pool. |\
| auto\_scale | boolean<br>A boolean value indicating whether auto-scaling is enabled for this node pool. |\
| min\_nodes | integer<br>The minimum number of nodes that this node pool can be auto-scaled to. The value will be `0` if `auto_scale` is set to `false`. |\
| max\_nodes | integer<br>The maximum number of nodes that this node pool can be auto-scaled to. The value will be `0` if `auto_scale` is set to `false`. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**201**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `node_pool`. The value of\
this will be an object containing the standard attributes of a node pool.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_update_nodePool](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_update_nodePool) Update a Node Pool in a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
To update the name of a node pool, edit the tags applied to it, or adjust its\
number of nodes, send a PUT request to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/node_pools/$NODE_POOL_ID` with the\
following attributes.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
| node\_pool\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: cdda885e-7663-40c8-bc74-3a036c66545d<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes node pool. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| name<br>required | string<br>A human-readable name for the node pool. |\
| count<br>required | integer<br>The number of Droplet instances in the node pool. |\
| tags | Array of strings<br>An array containing the tags applied to the node pool. All node pools are automatically tagged `k8s`, `k8s-worker`, and `k8s:$K8S_CLUSTER_ID`. <br>Requires `tag:read` scope. |\
| labels | object or null<br>An object of key/value mappings specifying labels to apply to all nodes in a pool. Labels will automatically be applied to all existing nodes and any subsequent nodes added to the pool. Note that when a label is removed, it is not deleted from the nodes in the pool. |\
| taints | Array of objects (kubernetes\_node\_pool\_taint) <br>An array of taints to apply to all nodes in a pool. Taints will automatically be applied to all existing nodes and any subsequent nodes added to the pool. When a taint is removed, it is deleted from all nodes in the pool. |\
| auto\_scale | boolean<br>A boolean value indicating whether auto-scaling is enabled for this node pool. |\
| min\_nodes | integer<br>The minimum number of nodes that this node pool can be auto-scaled to. The value will be `0` if `auto_scale` is set to `false`. |\
| max\_nodes | integer<br>The maximum number of nodes that this node pool can be auto-scaled to. The value will be `0` if `auto_scale` is set to `false`. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**202**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `node_pool`. The value of\
this will be an object containing the standard attributes of a node pool.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_delete_nodePool](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_delete_nodePool) Delete a Node Pool in a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
To delete a node pool, send a DELETE request to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/node_pools/$NODE_POOL_ID`.\
\
A 204 status code with no body will be returned in response to a successful\
request. Nodes in the pool will subsequently be drained and deleted.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
| node\_pool\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: cdda885e-7663-40c8-bc74-3a036c66545d<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes node pool. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**204**\
\
The action was successful and the response body is empty.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\
delete/v2/kubernetes/clusters/{cluster\_id}/node\_pools/{node\_pool\_id}\
\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_delete_node](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_delete_node) Delete a Node in a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
To delete a single node in a pool, send a DELETE request to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/node_pools/$NODE_POOL_ID/nodes/$NODE_ID`.\
\
Appending the `skip_drain=1` query parameter to the request causes node\
draining to be skipped. Omitting the query parameter or setting its value to\
`0` carries out draining prior to deletion.\
\
Appending the `replace=1` query parameter to the request causes the node to\
be replaced by a new one after deletion. Omitting the query parameter or\
setting its value to `0` deletes without replacement.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
| node\_pool\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: cdda885e-7663-40c8-bc74-3a036c66545d<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes node pool. |\
| node\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: 478247f8-b1bb-4f7a-8db9-2a5f8d4b8f8f<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a node in a Kubernetes node pool. |\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| skip\_drain | integer \[ 0 .. 1 \] <br>Default: 0<br>Example: skip\_drain=1<br>Specifies whether or not to drain workloads from a node before it is deleted. Setting it to `1` causes node draining to be skipped. Omitting the query parameter or setting its value to `0` carries out draining prior to deletion. |\
| replace | integer \[ 0 .. 1 \] <br>Default: 0<br>Example: replace=1<br>Specifies whether or not to replace a node after it has been deleted. Setting it to `1` causes the node to be replaced by a new one after deletion. Omitting the query parameter or setting its value to `0` deletes without replacement. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**202**\
\
This does not indicate the success or failure of any operation, just that the request has been accepted for processing.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\

## [tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_run_clusterLint](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Kubernetes/operation/kubernetes_run_clusterLint) Run Clusterlint Checks on a Kubernetes Cluster\
\
Clusterlint helps operators conform to Kubernetes best practices around\
resources, security and reliability to avoid common problems while operating\
or upgrading the clusters.\
\
To request a clusterlint run on your cluster, send a POST request to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/clusterlint`. This will run all\
checks present in the `doks` group by default, if a request body is not\
specified. Optionally specify the below attributes.\
\
For information about the available checks, please refer to\
[the clusterlint check documentation](https://github.com/digitalocean/clusterlint/blob/master/checks.md).\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| cluster\_id<br>required | string <uuid>  >= 1 <br>Example: bd5f5959-5e1e-4205-a714-a914373942af<br>A unique ID that can be used to reference a Kubernetes cluster. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| include\_groups | Array of strings<br>An array of check groups that will be run when clusterlint executes checks. |\
| include\_checks | Array of strings<br>An array of checks that will be run when clusterlint executes checks. |\
| exclude\_groups | Array of strings<br>An array of check groups that will be omitted when clusterlint executes checks. |\
| exclude\_checks | Array of strings<br>An array of checks that will be run when clusterlint executes checks. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**202**\
\
The response is a JSON object with a key called `run_id` that you can later use to fetch the run results.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**404**\
\
The resource was not found.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\

\
To request clusterlint diagnostics for your cluster, send a GET request to\
`/v2/kubernetes/clusters/$K8S_CLUSTER_ID/clusterlint`. If the `run_id` query\
parameter is provided, then the diagnostics for the specific run is fetched.\
By default, the latest results are shown.\

To find out how to address clusterlint feedback, please refer to\
[the clusterlint check documentation](https://github.com/digitalocean/clusterlint/blob/master/checks.md).\

\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| run\_id | string <uuid> <br>Example: run\_id=50c2f44c-011d-493e-aee5-361a4a0d1844<br>Specifies the clusterlint run whose results will be retrieved. |\
\

objects in the cluster. Each diagnostic will contain some metadata information\

| --- | --- |\

## [tag/Load-Balancers](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Load-Balancers) Load Balancers\
\
[DigitalOcean Load Balancers](https://docs.digitalocean.com/products/networking/load-balancers/)\
provide a way to distribute traffic across multiple Droplets. By sending\
requests to the `/v2/load_balancers` endpoint, you can list, create, or\
delete load balancers as well as add or remove Droplets, forwarding rules,\
and other configuration details.\
\
## [tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_create](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_create) Create a New Load Balancer\
\
To create a new load balancer instance, send a POST request to\
`/v2/load_balancers`.\
\
You can specify the Droplets that will sit behind the load balancer using one\
of two methods:\
\
- Set `droplet_ids` to a list of specific Droplet IDs.\
- Set `tag` to the name of a tag. All Droplets with this tag applied will be\
assigned to the load balancer. Additional Droplets will be automatically\
assigned as they are tagged.\
\
These methods are mutually exclusive.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
One of\
\
Assign Droplets by IDAssign Droplets by Tag\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| droplet\_ids<br>required | Array of integers<br>An array containing the IDs of the Droplets assigned to the load balancer. |\
| region<br>required | string (region\_slug) <br>Enum:"ams1""ams2""ams3""blr1""fra1""lon1""nyc1""nyc2""nyc3""sfo1""sfo2""sfo3""sgp1""tor1""syd1"<br>The slug identifier for the region where the resource will initially be available. |\
| name | string<br>A human-readable name for a load balancer instance. |\
| project\_id | string<br>The ID of the project that the load balancer is associated with. If no ID is provided at creation, the load balancer associates with the user's default project. If an invalid project ID is provided, the load balancer will not be created. |\
| size\_unit | integer \[ 1 .. 100 \] <br>Default: 1<br>How many nodes the load balancer contains. Each additional node increases the load balancer's ability to manage more connections. Load balancers can be scaled up or down, and you can change the number of nodes after creation up to once per hour. This field is currently not available in the AMS2, NYC2, or SFO1 regions. Use the `size` field to scale load balancers that reside in these regions. |\
| size | string<br>Deprecated <br>Default: "lb-small"<br>Enum:"lb-small""lb-medium""lb-large"<br>This field has been replaced by the `size_unit` field for all regions except in AMS2, NYC2, and SFO1. Each available load balancer size now equates to the load balancer having a set number of nodes.<br>- `lb-small` = 1 node<br>- `lb-medium` = 3 nodes<br>- `lb-large` = 6 nodes<br>You can resize load balancers after creation up to once per hour. You cannot resize a load balancer within the first hour of its creation. |\
| algorithm | string<br>Deprecated <br>Default: "round\_robin"<br>Enum:"round\_robin""least\_connections"<br>This field has been deprecated. You can no longer specify an algorithm for load balancers. |\
| forwarding\_rules<br>required | Array of objects (forwarding\_rule)  non-empty <br>An array of objects specifying the forwarding rules for a load balancer. |\
| health\_check | object (health\_check) <br>An object specifying health check settings for the load balancer. |\
| sticky\_sessions | object (sticky\_sessions) <br>An object specifying sticky sessions settings for the load balancer. |\
| redirect\_http\_to\_https | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether HTTP requests to the load balancer on port 80 will be redirected to HTTPS on port 443. |\
| enable\_proxy\_protocol | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether PROXY Protocol is in use. |\
| enable\_backend\_keepalive | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether HTTP keepalive connections are maintained to target Droplets. |\
| http\_idle\_timeout\_seconds | integer \[ 30 .. 600 \] <br>Default: 60<br>An integer value which configures the idle timeout for HTTP requests to the target droplets. |\
| vpc\_uuid | string <uuid> <br>A string specifying the UUID of the VPC to which the load balancer is assigned. |\
| disable\_lets\_encrypt\_dns\_records | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether to disable automatic DNS record creation for Let's Encrypt certificates that are added to the load balancer. |\
| firewall | object (lb\_firewall) <br>An object specifying allow and deny rules to control traffic to the load balancer. |\
| network | string<br>Default: "EXTERNAL"<br>Enum:"EXTERNAL""INTERNAL"<br>A string indicating whether the load balancer should be external or internal. Internal load balancers have no public IPs and are only accessible to resources on the same VPC network. This property cannot be updated after creating the load balancer. |\
| network\_stack | string<br>Default: "IPV4"<br>Enum:"IPV4""DUALSTACK"<br>A string indicating whether the load balancer will support IPv4 or both IPv4 and IPv6 networking. This property cannot be updated after creating the load balancer. |\
| type | string<br>Default: "REGIONAL"<br>Enum:"REGIONAL""REGIONAL\_NETWORK""GLOBAL"<br>A string indicating whether the load balancer should be a standard regional HTTP load balancer, a regional network load balancer that routes traffic at the TCP/UDP transport layer, or a global load balancer. |\
| domains | Array of objects (domains) <br>An array of objects specifying the domain configurations for a Global load balancer. |\
| glb\_settings | object (glb\_settings) <br>An object specifying forwarding configurations for a Global load balancer. |\
| target\_load\_balancer\_ids | Array of strings<br>An array containing the UUIDs of the Regional load balancers to be used as target backends for a Global load balancer. |\
| tls\_cipher\_policy | string<br>Default: "DEFAULT"<br>Enum:"DEFAULT""STRONG"<br>A string indicating the policy for the TLS cipher suites used by the load balancer. The possible values are `DEFAULT` or `STRONG`. The default value is `DEFAULT`. |\

## [tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_list](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_list) List All Load Balancers\
\
To list all of the load balancer instances on your account, send a GET request\
to `/v2/load_balancers`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| per\_page | integer \[ 1 .. 200 \] <br>Default: 20<br>Example: per\_page=2<br>Number of items returned per page |\
| page | integer >= 1 <br>Default: 1<br>Example: page=1<br>Which 'page' of paginated results to return. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
A JSON object with a key of `load_balancers`. This will be set to an array of objects, each of which will contain the standard load balancer attributes.\

\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\

## [tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_get](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_get) Retrieve an Existing Load Balancer\
\
To show information about a load balancer instance, send a GET request to\
`/v2/load_balancers/$LOAD_BALANCER_ID`.\
\

\

\
**200**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `load_balancer`. The\
value of this will be an object that contains the standard attributes\
associated with a load balancer\

\

\

\

## [tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_update](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Load-Balancers/operation/loadBalancers_update) Update a Load Balancer\
\
To update a load balancer's settings, send a PUT request to\
`/v2/load_balancers/$LOAD_BALANCER_ID`. The request should contain a full\
representation of the load balancer including existing attributes. It may\
contain _one of_ the `droplets_ids` or `tag` attributes as they are mutually\
exclusive. **Note that any attribute that is not provided will be reset to its**\
**default value.**\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| lb\_id<br>required | string >= 1 <br>Example: 4de7ac8b-495b-4884-9a69-1050c6793cd6<br>A unique identifier for a load balancer. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
One of\
\
Assign Droplets by IDAssign Droplets by Tag\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| droplet\_ids<br>required | Array of integers<br>An array containing the IDs of the Droplets assigned to the load balancer. |\
| region<br>required | string (region\_slug) <br>Enum:"ams1""ams2""ams3""blr1""fra1""lon1""nyc1""nyc2""nyc3""sfo1""sfo2""sfo3""sgp1""tor1""syd1"<br>The slug identifier for the region where the resource will initially be available. |\
| name | string<br>A human-readable name for a load balancer instance. |\
| project\_id | string<br>The ID of the project that the load balancer is associated with. If no ID is provided at creation, the load balancer associates with the user's default project. If an invalid project ID is provided, the load balancer will not be created. |\
| size\_unit | integer \[ 1 .. 100 \] <br>Default: 1<br>How many nodes the load balancer contains. Each additional node increases the load balancer's ability to manage more connections. Load balancers can be scaled up or down, and you can change the number of nodes after creation up to once per hour. This field is currently not available in the AMS2, NYC2, or SFO1 regions. Use the `size` field to scale load balancers that reside in these regions. |\
| size | string<br>Deprecated <br>Default: "lb-small"<br>Enum:"lb-small""lb-medium""lb-large"<br>This field has been replaced by the `size_unit` field for all regions except in AMS2, NYC2, and SFO1. Each available load balancer size now equates to the load balancer having a set number of nodes.<br>- `lb-small` = 1 node<br>- `lb-medium` = 3 nodes<br>- `lb-large` = 6 nodes<br>You can resize load balancers after creation up to once per hour. You cannot resize a load balancer within the first hour of its creation. |\
| algorithm | string<br>Deprecated <br>Default: "round\_robin"<br>Enum:"round\_robin""least\_connections"<br>This field has been deprecated. You can no longer specify an algorithm for load balancers. |\
| forwarding\_rules<br>required | Array of objects (forwarding\_rule)  non-empty <br>An array of objects specifying the forwarding rules for a load balancer. |\
| health\_check | object (health\_check) <br>An object specifying health check settings for the load balancer. |\
| sticky\_sessions | object (sticky\_sessions) <br>An object specifying sticky sessions settings for the load balancer. |\
| redirect\_http\_to\_https | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether HTTP requests to the load balancer on port 80 will be redirected to HTTPS on port 443. |\
| enable\_proxy\_protocol | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether PROXY Protocol is in use. |\
| enable\_backend\_keepalive | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether HTTP keepalive connections are maintained to target Droplets. |\
| http\_idle\_timeout\_seconds | integer \[ 30 .. 600 \] <br>Default: 60<br>An integer value which configures the idle timeout for HTTP requests to the target droplets. |\
| vpc\_uuid | string <uuid> <br>A string specifying the UUID of the VPC to which the load balancer is assigned. |\
| disable\_lets\_encrypt\_dns\_records | boolean<br>Default: false<br>A boolean value indicating whether to disable automatic DNS record creation for Let's Encrypt certificates that are added to the load balancer. |\
| firewall | object (lb\_firewall) <br>An object specifying allow and deny rules to control traffic to the load balancer. |\
| network | string<br>Default: "EXTERNAL"<br>Enum:"EXTERNAL""INTERNAL"<br>A string indicating whether the load balancer should be external or internal. Internal load balancers have no public IPs and are only accessible to resources on the same VPC network. This property cannot be updated after creating the load balancer. |\
| network\_stack | string<br>Default: "IPV4"<br>Enum:"IPV4""DUALSTACK"<br>A string indicating whether the load balancer will support IPv4 or both IPv4 and IPv6 networking. This property cannot be updated after creating the load balancer. |\
| type | string<br>Default: "REGIONAL"<br>Enum:"REGIONAL""REGIONAL\_NETWORK""GLOBAL"<br>A string indicating whether the load balancer should be a standard regional HTTP load balancer, a regional network load balancer that routes traffic at the TCP/UDP transport layer, or a global load balancer. |\
| domains | Array of objects (domains) <br>An array of objects specifying the domain configurations for a Global load balancer. |\
| glb\_settings | object (glb\_settings) <br>An object specifying forwarding configurations for a Global load balancer. |\
| target\_load\_balancer\_ids | Array of strings<br>An array containing the UUIDs of the Regional load balancers to be used as target backends for a Global load balancer. |\
| tls\_cipher\_policy | string<br>Default: "DEFAULT"<br>Enum:"DEFAULT""STRONG"<br>A string indicating the policy for the TLS cipher suites used by the load balancer. The possible values are `DEFAULT` or `STRONG`. The default value is `DEFAULT`. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `load_balancer`. The\
value of this will be an object containing the standard attributes of a\
load balancer.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\

\
The resource was not found.\
\

\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\

and removing it from your account, send a DELETE request to\
`/v2/load_balancers/$LOAD_BALANCER_ID`.\

A successful request will receive a 204 status code with no body in response.\

\
To assign a Droplet to a load balancer instance, send a POST request to\
`/v2/load_balancers/$LOAD_BALANCER_ID/droplets`. In the body of the request,\

## [tag/Monitoring/operation/monitoring_create_alertPolicy](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Monitoring/operation/monitoring_create_alertPolicy) Create Alert Policy\
\
To create a new alert, send a POST request to `/v2/monitoring/alerts`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
The `type` field dictates what type of entity that the alert policy applies to and hence what type of entity is passed in the `entities` array. If both the `tags` array and `entities` array are empty the alert policy applies to all entities of the relevant type that are owned by the user account. Otherwise the following table shows the valid entity types for each type of alert policy:\
\
| Type | Description | Valid Entity Type |\
| --- | --- | --- |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/memory_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of memory utilization | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/disk_read` | alert on the rate of disk read I/O in MBps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/load_5` | alert on the 5 minute load average | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/load_15` | alert on the 15 minute load average | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/disk_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of disk utilization | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/cpu` | alert on the percent of CPU utilization | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/disk_write` | alert on the rate of disk write I/O in MBps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/public_outbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of public outbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/public_inbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of public inbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/private_outbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of private outbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/private_inbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of private inbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/load_1` | alert on the 1 minute load average | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/avg_cpu_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of CPU utilization | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/connection_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of connection utilization | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/droplet_health` | alert on Droplet health status changes | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/tls_connections_per_second_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of TLS connections per second utilization (requires at least one HTTPS forwarding rule) | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_percentage_5xx` | alert on the percent increase of 5xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_percentage_4xx` | alert on the percent increase of 4xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_count_5xx` | alert on the count of 5xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_count_4xx` | alert on the count of 4xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time` | alert on high average http response time | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time_50p` | alert on high 50th percentile http response time | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time_95p` | alert on high 95th percentile http response time | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time_99p` | alert on high 99th percentile http response time | load balancer ID |\

## [tag/Monitoring/operation/monitoring_update_alertPolicy](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Monitoring/operation/monitoring_update_alertPolicy) Update an Alert Policy\
\
To update en existing policy, send a PUT request to `v2/monitoring/alerts/{alert_uuid}`.\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### path Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| alert\_uuid<br>required | string<br>Example: 4de7ac8b-495b-4884-9a69-1050c6793cd6<br>A unique identifier for an alert policy. |\
\
##### Request Body schema: application/json  required\
\
The `type` field dictates what type of entity that the alert policy applies to and hence what type of entity is passed in the `entities` array. If both the `tags` array and `entities` array are empty the alert policy applies to all entities of the relevant type that are owned by the user account. Otherwise the following table shows the valid entity types for each type of alert policy:\
\
| Type | Description | Valid Entity Type |\
| --- | --- | --- |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/memory_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of memory utilization | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/disk_read` | alert on the rate of disk read I/O in MBps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/load_5` | alert on the 5 minute load average | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/load_15` | alert on the 15 minute load average | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/disk_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of disk utilization | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/cpu` | alert on the percent of CPU utilization | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/disk_write` | alert on the rate of disk write I/O in MBps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/public_outbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of public outbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/public_inbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of public inbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/private_outbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of private outbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/private_inbound_bandwidth` | alert on the rate of private inbound bandwidth in Mbps | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/droplet/load_1` | alert on the 1 minute load average | Droplet ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/avg_cpu_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of CPU utilization | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/connection_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of connection utilization | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/droplet_health` | alert on Droplet health status changes | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/tls_connections_per_second_utilization_percent` | alert on the percent of TLS connections per second utilization (requires at least one HTTPS forwarding rule) | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_percentage_5xx` | alert on the percent increase of 5xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_percentage_4xx` | alert on the percent increase of 4xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_count_5xx` | alert on the count of 5xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/increase_in_http_error_rate_count_4xx` | alert on the count of 4xx level http errors over 5m | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time` | alert on high average http response time | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time_50p` | alert on high 50th percentile http response time | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time_95p` | alert on high 95th percentile http response time | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/insights/lbaas/high_http_request_response_time_99p` | alert on high 99th percentile http response time | load balancer ID |\
| `v1/dbaas/alerts/load_15_alerts` | alert on 15 minute load average across the database cluster | database cluster UUID |\
| `v1/dbaas/alerts/memory_utilization_alerts` | alert on the percent memory utilization average across the database cluster | database cluster UUID |\
| `v1/dbaas/alerts/disk_utilization_alerts` | alert on the percent disk utilization average across the database cluster | database cluster UUID |\
| `v1/dbaas/alerts/cpu_alerts` | alert on the percent CPU usage average across the database cluster | database cluster UUID |\

## [tag/Monitoring/operation/monitoring_get_dropletBandwidthMetrics](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/Monitoring/operation/monitoring_get_dropletBandwidthMetrics) Get Droplet Bandwidth Metrics\
\
To retrieve bandwidth metrics for a given Droplet, send a GET request to `/v2/monitoring/metrics/droplet/bandwidth`. Use the `interface` query parameter to specify if the results should be for the `private` or `public` interface. Use the `direction` query parameter to specify if the results should be for `inbound` or `outbound` traffic.\
The metrics in the response body are in megabits per second (Mbps).\
\
##### Authorizations:\
\
_bearer\_auth_\
\
##### query Parameters\
\
|     |     |\
| --- | --- |\
| host\_id<br>required | string<br>Example: host\_id=17209102<br>The droplet ID. |\
| interface<br>required | string<br>Enum:"private""public"<br>Example: interface=private<br>The network interface. |\
| direction<br>required | string<br>Enum:"inbound""outbound"<br>Example: direction=inbound<br>The traffic direction. |\
| start<br>required | string<br>Example: start=1620683817<br>UNIX timestamp to start metric window. |\
| end<br>required | string<br>Example: end=1620705417<br>UNIX timestamp to end metric window. |\
\
### Responses\
\
**200**\
\
The response will be a JSON object with a key called `data` and `status`.\
\
**401**\
\
Authentication failed due to invalid credentials.\
\
**429**\
\
The API rate limit has been exceeded.\
\
**500**\
\
There was a server error.\
\
**default**\
\
There was an unexpected error.\
\

## [tag/NFS](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/NFS) NFS\
\
NFS lets you create fully managed, POSIX-compliant network file storage that delivers secure,\
high-performance shared storage right inside your VPC. This enables seamless data sharing across Droplets in a VPC.\
\
## [tag/NFS/operation/nfs_create](https://docs.digitalocean.com/reference/api/digitalocean//\#tag/NFS/operation/nfs_create) Create a new NFS share\

| region<br>required | string<br>The DigitalOcean region slug (e.g., nyc2, atl1) where the NFS share resides. |\
| vpc\_ids<br>required | Array of strings<br>List of VPC IDs that should be able to access the share. |\

### Responses\

**201**\
\
A JSON response containing details about the new NFS share.\

\
